abstract: A brutal stock market reaction to Netflix's subscriber losses has left the company with a market value about one-quarter of what it once was.
snippet: A brutal stock market reaction to Netflix's subscriber losses has left the company with a market value about one-quarter of what it once was.
lead_paragraph: In July, Netflix's market value was over $16 billion. On Tuesday, after a bruising response to the financial results the company released late Monday, the Internet movie company lost more than $2 billion in value, bringing its total market capitalization to just over $4 billion.
